Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I was diagnosed with breast cancer in my right breast back in 2009, I had surgery, chemo, radiotherapy followed by tamoxifen. I was taken off the tamoxifen as it affected my other medication which I rely upon to keep my mental health on an even keel. After a routine mammogram early this year I was diagnosed with left breast cancer, this was a new cancer not related to the first one. When I first went to my GP I went with a left inverted nipple only to be later told i had right breast cancer. I have just finished 3 Fec and 3 Taxotere. I have an appointment on Monday to see the oncologist and the radiotherapy consultant. This all seems so surreal because I have been here before!! My oncologist did tell me that it was uncommon to get breast cancer in the opposite breast after the first occasion, but did also say that because it is hormone dependant it would be a good idea to have my ovaries removed so that i did not produce as much of the hormone which the cancer cells rely on to feed off, so I still have some way to go. Has anyone else been in a similar position and I`m sorry for going on but just needed to let off a bit of steam!! Take care, Tracey
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer for a second time in opposite breast

Posts.Content: Hi wonkey donkey, Welcome to the Online Community. I'm sorry to hear about your cancer but I'm glad you found us here.  I noticed you wanted to meet others locally - you might find our In Your Area tool really helpful for this. I'm afraid we don't allow members to disclose their personal details on the Online Community for privacy reasons - I hope you can understand.  I hope you find this useful but please don’t hesitate to get back in contact if you have any more questions about this or need some more help. Kind regards, Tracey Macmillan Community Team

Posts.Title: Anyone in Exeter?

Posts.Content: Hi, I went to the hospital yesterday to have my picc line flushed and to be given information on taxotere  which I should have started 2/7/12, only to be told my my macmillan nurse and oncologist that chemo will have to be deferred for two weeks and that for the same period I will have to take a course of antibiotics as I have a skin infection in my head and body.
Posts.Title: Chemo deferred for 2 WEEKS

Posts.Content: I really don`t  know how I feel or should be feeling after getting breast cancer for a second time, I`m not sure that I have got my head around the first time but the second time seems surreal. Could it be my own fault for getting breast cancer a second timeas I had to stop taking Tamoxifen?, a question I ask myself many times over. Even though my breast care nurse says to me "its a good type of cancer to have, because it is hormone positive" to me its still that dreaded word cancer. I don`t know what to think or feel.
Posts.Title: Thoughts and feelings after having breast cancer twice
